pages.text_verbatim_title_block:
PROJECT: 14-UNIT STACKED TOWN 768 ARLINGTON ST. 
SHEET TITLE: CODE REQ. & BLDG SECTION 
SHEET NO.: C1 
DATE: MAY 22, 2025 
DRAWN BY: BLR 
CHECKED BY: BLR 
SCALE: AS NOTED 
JOB NO.: 25-01-035
pages.general_notes_verbatim:
GENERAL NOTES 
1. DESIGN & CONSTRUCTION OF ALL WORK ON THIS PROJECT SHALL CONFORM TO THE LATEST EDITION OF THE ONTARIO BUILDING CODE. 
2. ALL DIMENSIONS ARE IN MILLIMETERS UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED. 
3. ALL DRAWINGS SHALL BE REVIEWED BY WADDELL ENGINEERING LTD. (WEL) PRIOR TO CONSTRUCTION. 
4. CONTRACTOR TO VERIFY ALL DIMENSIONS AND CONDITIONS ON SITE PRIOR TO COMMENCING WORK. 
5. ANY DISCREPANCIES SHALL BE REPORTED TO THE ENGINEER IMMEDIATELY. 
6. ALL WORK SHALL BE CARRIED OUT IN A WORKMANLIKE MANNER. 
7. CONTRACTOR SHALL MAINTAIN THE SITE IN A SAFE CONDITION AT ALL TIMES. 
8. CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE ADEQUATE PROTECTION FOR THE PUBLIC AND WORKERS AT ALL TIMES. 
9. CONTRACTOR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE PROTECTION OF ALL EXISTING STRUCTURES AND UTILITIES. 
10. CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE ALL NECESSARY TEMPORARY SUPPORTS AND SHORING AS REQUIRED. 
11. CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE ALL NECESSARY SAFETY BARRIERS AND SIGNAGE AS REQUIRED. 
12. CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE ALL NECESSARY TEMPORARY FENCING AND HOARDING AS REQUIRED.
pages.page_overview_summary: This sheet provides a comprehensive overview of the building's structural requirements, including general and foundation notes, wall, roof, and floor types. It includes a building section that illustrates the relationship between different levels. The notes emphasize compliance with the Ontario Building Code and outline responsibilities for site safety and verification of dimensions. This sheet serves as a foundational reference for the project's structural design.

pages.page_overview_summary: This sheet illustrates the front and right side elevations of the 14-unit stacked townhouse project. It provides detailed views of the facade, including window and door placements, and architectural features across multiple units. The elevations help visualize the building's exterior appearance and are essential for understanding the design's aesthetic and structural elements.

pages.text_verbatim_title_block:
PROJECT: 14-UNIT STACKED TOWN 768 ARLINGTON ST. 
SHEET TITLE: FOUNDATION PLAN 
SHEET NO.: C4 
DATE: MAY 22, 2025 
DRAWN BY: BLR 
CHECKED BY: BLR 
SCALE: AS NOTED 
JOB NO.: 25-01-035
pages.general_notes_verbatim:
FOUNDATION NOTES 
1. ALL FOOTINGS SHALL BEAR ON UNDISTURBED SOIL OR ENGINEERED FILL. 
2. ALL CONCRETE SHALL HAVE A MINIMUM COMPRESSIVE STRENGTH OF 25 MPa AT 28 DAYS. 
3. REINFORCEMENT SHALL BE AS SPECIFIED ON THE DRAWINGS. 
4. ALL FOOTINGS SHALL BE PLACED AT A MINIMUM DEPTH OF 1.2m BELOW FINISHED GRADE. 
5. ALL FOUNDATION WALLS SHALL BE WATERPROOFED AS SPECIFIED.
pages.page_overview_summary: The foundation plan details the layout and specifications for the building's foundation, including footings and concrete walls. It provides essential information for constructing the foundation, ensuring stability and compliance with structural requirements. The notes specify material strengths and construction depths, critical for the foundation's integrity.

pages.page_overview_summary: This sheet includes structural details and general notes that apply to the entire project. It outlines design loads and construction requirements, ensuring compliance with building codes and structural integrity. The notes provide guidance on construction practices and safety measures, serving as a critical reference for the project.
